Direct message the job poster from On Target Executive Search, A Division Of On Target Staffing LLC
Angelique W.
Senior Director of Executive Search
Do You Love Movies?!Do You Live In Los Angeles?!Do You Know Market Research?!Now is Your chance to work with major film studios and streaming service providers!Director of Market Research AnalyticsOur client is a leading entertainment research company who is seeking an experienced analyst and strategic consultant with an expertise in film custom market research. The ideal candidate will have deep experience with a wide range of market research techniques (both quantitative and qualitative) including the design and execution of studies across the life-cycle of entertainment properties, as well as demonstrated expertise delivering insightful and actionable reports to creative, marketing and distribution executives.What You Will Do:Oversight of brand, positioning and messaging studies, including design, analysis, and reporting, centered on delivery of client-ready narratives with clear strategic direction based on a close reading of both primary and secondary data sets. Analyst will both execute and provide leadership to a team in the design of questionnaires, programming instructions, data processing specs and data tables, report shells and final client deliverables in MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint. For both custom and syndicated studies, Analyst will be called upon to compile and analyze historical comp sets, create and validate code frames, and author summaries of scripts, films or other entertainment content. What You Need to Have:BA/BS required. All candidates must demonstrate strong academic or professional background in both market research and/or data analysis as well as film production and/or marketing.6+ years of research and analytics experience. Qual/Quant comfortable data, survey, tab data collection and tabulated.Fully proficient in PowerPoint design skills, Excel, and WordStrong writing skills and demonstrated ability to effectively tell a research story that delivers on defined research objectives.Ability to work both independently and in collaboration with a larger analytical team to deliver polished reports on tight timelines.Extensive experience presenting research findings in clear, accessible terms that resonate with both creative and marketing executives.Intimate familiarity with a broad range of market research methodologies and techniques (e.g. monadic testing, segmentation, conjoint, MaxDiff) and ability to quickly assess project goals and recommend most effective optionsComfortable working with both large quantitative data sets and qualitative resultsRobust understanding of the movie industry and ongoing fluency in the movies, franchises, producers, studios, and streamers impacting current and future entertainment trendsSpecial consideration given for candidates with experience writing about market-focused entertainment topics from either a journalistic or academic perspective.Flexible availability, including frequent work on evenings and weekends.What You Will Get:$110-125k base DOERemote work arrangements-need to be based in or near Los Angeles area and be available to work from company offices as well as attend meetings, presentations, and research events around the greater Los Angeles area.MedicalDentalPaid Time Off401k
